properties.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 8 at 11:02AM EST by NWS State College PA
properties.description:
HAZARDS...A snow squall which can rapidly reduce visibility to less
than a quarter of a mile.

LOCATION AND MOVEMENT...At 1101 AM EST, a snow squall was near Penn
National Race Course moving east at 40 MPH.

THIS SQUALL WILL BE NEAR...
Penn National Race Course and Fort Indiantown Gap around 1105 AM
EST.
Harper Tavern around 1110 AM EST.
Palmyra around 1115 AM EST.
Annville around 1120 AM EST.
Lebanon, Pleasant Hill and Cleona around 1125 AM EST.
Cornwall, Lebanon South and Quentin around 1130 AM EST.

This includes the following Interstates...
The Pennsylvania Turnpike from mile markers 270 to 277.
Interstate 78 near mile marker 0.
Interstate 81 from mile markers 77 to 88.

SAFETY INFO...
A rapid drop in temperature may lead to the rapid formation of black
ice on area roadways. Black ice is nearly impossible to see and
roadways may appear wet. Please use extreme caution, especially on
bridges, overpasses and around curves. Allow plenty of stopping
distance and avoid braking suddenly.

Icy roads are possible as the snow melts on the roadway and then
quickly refreezes.

NWSheadline: A SNOW SQUALL WILL AFFECT PARTS OF LANCASTER...LEBANON...AND DAUPHIN COUNTIES
